intro: Aylostera kupperiana, commonly known as the Kupper's aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Aylostera kupperiana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat.
